nodes.text: Breta Yaga was an astronomical object located within the Breta Yaga system, a part of the Outer Rim Territories' Mieru'kar sector. Several art pieces called flatsculps that were produced by a non-Human species originated on Breta Yaga. The flatsculps were stored in the Mount Tantiss complex on the Ojoster sector planet Wayland by the time of the facility's destruction in 9 ABY. The New Republic historian Voren Na'al later mentioned Breta Yaga in his journal.

Breta Yaga was first mentioned in "Field Report," a short segment written from an in-universe perspective that was published as part of the 1994 sourcebook The Last Command Sourcebook, authored by Eric Trautmann for the West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed the Breta Yaga system, and therefore the celestial body Breta Yaga, within grid square O-3.
